Revenant Hill was to be the first game from The Glory Society, the new studio founded by former Night In The Woods developers Bethany Hockenberry and Scott Benson. Unfortunately due to "recent serious health issues" affecting several members of the team, the team have decided to "suspend operations" and end development.

 
Read more
articles.title: Night in the Woods co-creators' next game cancelled amid "serious health issues"

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
Lexar's NM790 4TB SSD has dipped to just £197, a great price for a high-end, high-capacity PCIe 4.0 NVMe drive that battles with the class-leading Samsung 990 Pro. This model is our current best cheap PCIe 4.0 SSD for gaming is well worth adding to your rig - though it has been slightly cheaper before and may yet fall further during the Black Friday sales.
Read more
articles.title: Lexar's NM790 4TB NVMe SSD is on sale again, this time at £198

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
Earlier this year - in September to be exact - we spotted a great deal on Dell's G2724D 27-inch Fast IPS monitor, which brought this model down from its original price of £299 to just £209. Two months later, we're back with an even better bargain - just £179 for a 1440p 165Hz monitor that sits right in the sweet spot for gaming. To get this deal, just use code GROUPON8 at the checkout! 
Read more
articles.title: Dell's 27-inch 1440p 165Hz gaming monitor, once £299, is now just £179

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The open world co-op survival game I liked most was Wurm Online, in which every action was performed via a right-click menu and we needed a town meeting to discuss who would spend the hours necessary to flatten a small patch of land. 

I therefore look at co-op survival game Enshrouded, with its voxel building, grapple hooks, wingsuits, and think: pah, what tomfoolery. This looks fun. Not at all my sort of thing. It might be yours, though. It's now got a January 24th release date and a new trailer, below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Co-op voxel survival 'em up Enshrouded will release in January

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 has named its first playable race: the Brujah, who love to settle brouhahas with brutal melee combat. A brief, fifteen second trailer showed a little of that combat in action in The Chinese Room's rebooted take on the RPG sequel. Find it below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2's first confirmed playable race is the Brujah, again

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
After almost two years in early access spanning 53 updates, sociable retro sci-fi FPS The Anacrusis has a 1.0 release date - 5th December 2023. The word "anacrusis" refers to a set of syllables that precede the first metrical foot in a line of poetry - an intriguing moniker for a game that is essentially Valve's Left 4 Dead, but set in a 1970s-styled high tech facility reminiscent of No One Lives Forever. I'll be honest, I haven't been keeping up with The Anacrusis, and assumed that it was one of those top-drawer philosophical puzzlers. Come on, there isn't even a pun in the title!

 
Read more
articles.title: Left 4 Dead's retro sci-fi cousin The Anacrusis will leave early access in December

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Hello folks. I know we've barely broken out of spooky season, but over in the RPS Treehouse we're rapidly preparing to warm up our vocal chords and bellow "It's CHRIIIIIIIISTMASSSSSS" from the rooftops in the spirit of Slade's seasonal epic. That's right. Advent Calendar season is upon us, and we'll be voting for our favourite games of the year very shortly. So I thought I'd use this month's Letter From The Editor to give you a little behind the scenes glimpse of how we'll be doing this in the coming weeks, and how we generally go about putting it all together every year.  
Read more
articles.title: Letter From The Editor #13: The Advent Calendar cometh

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Medieval multiplayer clangfest Chivalry 2 gets a free Reclamation update today, the cherry on the cake of which - knob on the coronet? Prong on the portculis? Ah wait, jewel in the crown! - is new 64-player map The Reclamation of Montcrux, in which the rampaging Agathians attempt to overrun a fort held by the Tenosians, pitting petard against bombard, battering ram against ballista. 


Gosh, that's a lot of medieval words. The translation is that one side has to run up the hill screaming while the other side lobs big balls of fire at them. Bash your way into the castle and you'll be able to stop the aforesaid rain of fireballs, though you'll still have to worry about getting dinged upside the headbone by dudes in plate. Onward, friends to the next paragraph! We have nothing to lose but our limbs!

 
Read more
articles.title: Chivalry 2 is back with a self-explanatory Last Peasant Standing mode and Montcrux castle map

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Early on in The Talos Principle 2, one of your soon-to-be robot pals says to you with a completely straight face, "We're here to solve this puzzle, not to discuss philosophy." I can almost see Croteam's writing team now, chuckling inwardly to themselves as they do a big silent wink to camera from behind the robot's eyes. You're not fooling me, Croteam. I'm here to solve puzzles and discuss philosophy, and I know you are too. You can't stop talking about philosophy in this game, and frankly, I wouldn't have it any other way. 
Millenia may have passed since the events of The Talos Principle, but the problems faced by this new society of advanced robo-humans (of which you are number 1000 to be 'born' into this world) still feel all too relevant to the issues posed by the lives we're living today: what is the price of progress? Will we ignore the mistakes of the past and push the world toward irreparable destruction? And why have cats remained loyal to this new race of robo-people, cementing their status as the superior future pet, when dogs have devolved back into vicious wolves? There are some puzzles too, I guess. Those are pretty great as well.
Read more
articles.title: The Talos Principle 2 review: masterful puzzles that will make your head spin with dizzying delight

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Laid-off Dragon Age: Dreadwolf and Mass Effect developers are attempting to turn this year's "N7 Day" of Mass Effect-themed festivities into a day of mass revolt. The developers in question are a mixture of former full-time staff and former Keywords Studios QA testers who have worked on Dreadwolf under contract. They've organised pickets outside BioWare Edmonton's offices in Canada, and are calling on BioWare fans to get involved on social media, while trying to engage current BioWare staff in conversation about unionisation.

 
Read more
articles.title: Laid-off Dragon Age: Dreadwolf and Mass Effect devs mark N7 Day by protesting outside BioWare HQ

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
People who play videogames want "new content literally almost every single day", according to Blizzard president Mike Ybarra - indeed, "they want new stuff every day, every hour". I do not want new stuff every day, every hour, Mike. Frankly, the idea makes me want to burn my possessions and go spend the rest of my life under a pine tree.

 
Read more
articles.title: "Players have no patience", says Blizzard president - "they want new stuff every day, every hour"

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
An achievement added to Baldur’s Gate 3’s GOG release has teased the possible addition of a new permadeath mode for the D&D RPG - meaning that if your whole party dies, your save will be permanently wiped. In a game where play time counts can end up in the hundreds of hours, that’s a fairly terrifying prospect.

 
Read more
articles.title: It looks like Baldur’s Gate 3 might be getting a permadeath mode

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Cities: Skylines 2 devs Colossal Order have said that the game known as the Builder of Cities and Destroyer of Framerates (at least, known as of me typing this) won’t get any paid expansions while they’re still getting its performance up to scratch.

 
Read more
articles.title: Cities: Skylines 2 won’t get paid DLC until its performance issues are sorted, devs say

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Fortnite returned to its map circa 2018 (or Chapter 1 Season 5 if you prefer to measure time that way) last Friday, reviving locations like Tilted Towers, Loot Lake and Greasy Grove and unlocking the battle royale game’s vaulted weapons, vehicles and items in a four-week nostalgic event dubbed Season OG. As it turns out, with the old map and items came a whole lot of players, setting a new all-time concurrent player record for the multiplayer shooter that surpasses even its previous heights in the pop-culture zeitgeist.

 
Read more
articles.title: Fortnite’s Season OG brought back its original map last week - and a record-breaking 44m players came with it

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Cryptic Studios, the makers of MMOs including Star Trek Online and Dungeons & Dragons MMORPG Neverwinter, have confirmed a number of layoffs due to the ongoing “comprehensive restructuring” of megacorp owner Embracer Group. The “personnel changes” at Cryptic make them the latest Embracer-owned developer to suffer job losses in what continues to be an unrelenting year for thousands of those working in video games.

 
Read more
articles.title: Star Trek Online and Neverwinter MMO devs Cryptic are the next Embracer-owned studio to suffer layoffs

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Much like Weyland-Yutani linking arms with Skynet, Microsoft have teamed up with Inworld to bring the latter's "generative AI" tools to Xbox studios. This "multi-year co-development partnership" will "build a powerful toolkit that harnesses artificial intelligence to enrich the narrative and character creation elements of game development", according to Inworld CEO Ilya Gelfenbeyn. You might recognise Inworld as the tech used by that GTA 5 mod about AI cultists in which characters speak AI-generated dialogue, which Rockstar blocked from distribution over the summer. Suffice to say that Microsoft have grander plans for it.

 
Read more
articles.title: Microsoft adopt Inworld AI tech behind blocked GTA5 mod to "enrich" videogame narrative and character creators

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
When I reviewed Hunt: Showdown for a different parish back in 2019, it was a swampy, stealthy, slow-paced extraction FPS that consisted of weaving through mouldy undead and pockets of inconveniently noisy wildlife, ears pricked for the rustle of a rival player in the bushes. It was a game in which every footfall felt like a gamble and every second lasted an eternity, even before you entered the lair of a giant spider. Fast  forward to 2023, and streamers are playing Hunt: Showdown like it's Titanfall 2, scurrying along walls with scant regard for the NPC cannon fodder below, duelling each other on rooftops with pistol shotguns, and tearing through those poor, befuddled boss monsters like sandcastles.


Thus the fate of any competitive shooter lucky enough to acquire a seasoned pro following, I guess. But still, returning to Crytek's PvPvE shooter has been a shock, and speaking to the development team, it sounds like the devs themselves have been struggling to keep up with the more ambitious players, too. Showdown was never expected to endure quite this long and evolve in quite this way, according to general manager David Fifield, and managing the community's ambitions for the game is as much of a challenge as compensating for the limitations of its ageing engine.

 
Read more
articles.title: The cat-and-mouse creation of Hunt: Showdown, and why there may never be a Hunt 2

articles.author: Sin Vega
articles.description:
While reviewing Cities Colon Skylines 2, I didn't actually go in that hard on public transport (beyond providing it and making it free), despite the urge. Since then though, it's become a game where I don't so much build a single mega-city as a series of experiments.
Naturally, those experiments devolved from a noble effort to remove the stain of cars into a sadistic urge to drive thousands of my own people on a never-ending hell march.
Read more
articles.title: My car-free Cities: Skylines 2 dream inevitably devolved into a cruel endurance test

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Hello folks. A small bit of RPS Game Club news today. Since it's starting to get toward end of the year season, Game Club will be taking a short break for the next two months. That means we won't be running it this month (November), or next month (December). We will, however, be returning with a fresh set of monthly game selections in 2024, so you can look forward to more group play-a-longs and liveblog chats early next year.
In the meantime, though, we hope you've enjoyed this first year's outing of the RPS Game Club, and we'd love to get some feedback on it for how we can improve next year. Regardless of whether you're a regular Game Clubber or have only ever watched it from afar, please come and join in the discussion below to help us make it even better.
Read more
articles.title: RPS Game Club will return again in January 2024

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
In 2021, Twitter user Thomas Violence, an Australian podcaster who was working in a bar at the time, recounted that a 19-year-old had asked for a refund on their drink because they realised they were too drunk already. One of the early replies was an "ummm actually," pointing out that you had to be 21 to buy booze in most states, and Thomas Violence responded "I'm one of the dozens of people worldwide that live in a country that's not America". I am reminded of this tweet a lot, and I am reminded of it whenever I log on to Puzzmo, a new daily browser-based puzzle service from Orta Therox and Zach "Zach Gage" Gage.
Puzzmo is great, and currently in a sort of gradually expanding beta where you can sign up to get a chance to be sent a log-in, or existing users can give two friends a log-in (I have used mine already, sorry). Every day you get a few different puzzles, with a subscription model offering bonus puzzles. I've not subbed because I'm just not built for anagram puzzles and I do not understand chess, which form about half of the daily offering, but I enjoy doing the daily fliparts and crosswords a lot. Except. The crosswords always have clues that are very specific to the USA.
Read more
articles.title: Puzzmo is great new daily puzzle hub for your browser, but the crosswords are very US-centric

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Mad dashes, daring escapes, last minute reversals: these are some of my favourite moments in multiplayer shooters. It’s exhilarating to scream towards the chopper in Left 4 Dead or a dropship in Titanfall. 

The Finals is a multiplayer shooter that seems to take place entirely at this elevated pitch. In the dozens of open beta matches I've played, the result is as thrilling as those other games, but also exhausting. I wish it would chill for just a moment so I could fully enjoy its delights - of which there are many.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Finals is a gloriously destructive shooter that's too frantic for its own good

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
Every weekend, indie devs show off current work on Twitter's #screenshotsaturday tag. And every Monday, I bring you a selection of these snaps and clips. This week, my eye has been kicking doors, clicking on shoes to walk, running along walls, and fiddling with buttons on a television in space. Come check out these attractive and interesting indie games, and more!
Read more
articles.title: Screenshot Saturday Mondays: Kicking in doors and clicking on shoes

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Devolver have released a Let's Play for robo-philosophical puzzler The Talos Principle 2 in which the Let's Player is GLaDOS, nemesis of Valve's Portal games, with which The Talos Principle has a few things in common. They've brought on original Portal voice actress Ellen McClain to narrate the footage, and the result is genuinely quite funny. As you'd expect, GlaDOS isn't that impressed by Croteam's work. I score this a 7/10 on the Hoot And/Or Holler scale.

 
Read more
articles.title: Devolver hire Portal's GLaDOS to Let's Play their Portal-esque puzzler The Talos Principle 2

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Bloober Team and Konami's forthcoming Silent Hill 2 remake will feature a playable origin story for Pyramid Head, according to a Best Buy listing. Specifically it says "fan favourite character, Pyramid Head, makes a return along with a special origin story for fans to play through." That's pretty much all she wrote, where the much vaunted "news-reporting" aspect of this news article is concerned. Now to spend several hundred words whining about why this is probably a terrible idea.

 
Read more
articles.title: Reports of a Silent Hill 2 remake "Pyramid Head origin story" fill me with the wrong kind of horror

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Sundays are for seeing lots of pals you've not seen in a while. Before you travel over, let's read this week's best writing about games (and game related things).
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Overwatch 2's next hero is Mauga, a chaingun-loving tank that seems reminiscent of Team Fortress 2's Heavy. He's due to join the free-to-player shooter in Season 8 on December 5th, but you can also give him a go right now until November 5th in a limited-time trial.

 
Read more
articles.title: Overwatch 2's next hero is available to try this weekend

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Opinions vary on whether 2005's Boiling Point: Road To Hell was ever, could ever have been, a good game. What's clear is that it was interesting, both as an early example of an open-world RPG and as an infamously broken example of Eurojank. Now it's getting a re-release in just ten days and I'm fascinated to know whether a Boiling Point with fewer bugs has anything to offer the world in 2023.

 
Read more
articles.title: Boiling Point: Road To Hell, one of the most delightfully buggy games ever, returns this month

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Diablo 4's first expansion will arrive sometime late in spaceyear 2024, but it's also a throwback to Diablo 2. That's because Vessel Of Hatred is all about one of the Prime Evils, Mephisto, who auld players would have slain in that most-beloved of hack-and-slashers. It's also going to add a new character class "never before seen in the Diablo universe."

 
Read more
articles.title: Diablo 4's first expansion revives Diablo 2's Mephisto, the Lord of Hatred

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Many World Of Warcraft expansions add a new continent, but The War Within, announced at Blizzcon this weekend, is a little different. It's set in a new subterranean world beneath Azeroth - and it kicks off a three-expansion story arc Blizzard are caling The Worldsoul Saga.

 
Read more
articles.title: World Of Warcraft's next three expansions have been announced, starting with The War Within

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
Remember remember the fifth of November, when either we celebrate someone being stopped from bursting the king or we celebrate someone trying. Sometimes I'm still not sure which. My head says thwarting, my heart says attempting. You wrap up warm, keep your pets safe, and enjoy the shmup particle effects. But what are you playing this weekend? Here's what we're clicking on!
Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
"The game is called Bloodthyrster X," the nerd-coded detective explains, twisting in their ill-fitting suit and furiously shaking an upside-down Xbox controller while their colleagues stare aghast at a TV screen looping a three-second clip of shoddy CGI ultraviolence. "The objective is to run over babies in your minivan while shooting cops and other players. It's taking over the dark web... and IRL."
You don't need me to tell you that fake video games appearing in TV shows and movies are typically absurd and terrible. But just because something is bad, doesn't mean it's uninteresting. Having watched dozens of movies and episodes with fake video games, I'm going to celebrate a few over the coming weeks. Some daft fake games have neat ideas, some shows portray their fake games in an interesting way, and some fake games are even quite good. Let's start now with Deadware, an unknown horror movie which does a great job recreating something a bit bad: a spOooky haunted browser game from 1999.
Read more
articles.title: Most fake games in movies and TV are ridiculous, but this horror nails a spooky 90s browser game

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Honkai: Star Rail has dropped a release date and details for its 1.5 update, taking the anime sci-fi RPG to a spooky new region with new events and three new characters along for the ride.

 
Read more
articles.title: Honkai: Star Rail heads to The Crepuscule Zone with three new characters and a spooky event in Version 1.5

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Greg ‘Ghostcrawler’ Street, the influential developer with credits on both World of Warcraft and League of Legends - including the MOBA’s unreleased MMO - is working on a new MMORPG under his own studio.

 
Read more
articles.title: Former World of Warcraft and League of Legends MMO developer is working on another new fantasy MMORPG

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Fortnite’s nostalgic latest season has kicked off, bringing back a slew of weapons, vehicles, items and cosmetics from the battle royale game’s first chapter. The truncated Fortnite Chapter 4 Season OG - which will last just four weeks, rather than the usual three months - has also restored the game’s original map as seen in Chapter 1, meaning the return of places like Tilted Towers, Loot Lake and Greasy Grove.

 
Read more
articles.title: Fortnite OG is here, bringing back planes, hamster balls, Tilted Towers and more over the next four weeks

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
This year’s Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 remake will no longer feature Weapon Tuning, a feature introduced by last year’s Modern Warfare 2 remake, which lots of people appear to despise. Unlocked by levelling up a weapon to the max, Weapon Tuning is an extra layer of the game’s Gunsmith weapon-building editor that lets you tweak individual attachment stats such as weight and length of grip, as displayed on a radar graph. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 chops much-disliked Weapon Tuning feature following community blowback

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Surprise! Diablo 4 only came out a few months ago, but there’s already a brand new Diablo game in the works. Two, in fact! The twist? These will be tabletop adaptations of Blizzard’s action-RPG series, taking Diablo into the realm occupied by Dungeons & Dragons and Catan.

 
Read more
articles.title: Diablo is getting a board game and tabletop RPG that will “continue the lore and story” of the video games

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Vampire Survivors is getting an Adventures update that will add "self-contained miniature story modes that reset and remix the game's content, following the Survivor's cast on a series of wacky sidequests". That's according to developer Poncle, who are clearly in a whimsical mood this week. After all, if there's one thing this game about auto-massacring ever larger crowds of kamikaze night creatures has been lacking, it's some proper narrative context. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Vampire Survivors Adventures update adds story modes, defying God and Man

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Readers, I must tell you something. If you're currently playing Alan Wake 2 and haven't continued with Alan's part of the story after reaching the point where you can switch between him and Saga, STOP WHAT YOU'RE DOING IMMEDIATELY. 
I know Saga's an infinitely better hang than Alan, but trust me on this. You are ignoring what is arguably the best 15 minutes of video game you'll play all year. Don't make the same mistake I did and play as Saga for 20 hours, only to realise that this utter masterpiece of a level was sitting here the entire time. Do the right thing. Continue Alan's story. You won't regret it (and spoilers to follow below, obvs).
Read more
articles.title: Don't miss this exquisite 15 minute setpiece in Alan Wake 2

articles.author: Sin Vega
articles.description:
What a great little thing. You've surely seen a hundred post-Minecraft games about building a base to smelt iron to build a base, and probably even thought to yourself that they look entirely fine but kind of... redundant? There's only so many times you can walk back and forth from a cave to a forge.
But what if instead of trudging around a grey cave, you were driving a big drilling machine instead? It's so simple, and yet it makes all the difference in GeoDepths.
Read more
articles.title: GeoDepths is digging and smelting, but good

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Final Fantasy XIV’s world of Eorzea is a utopia. Sure, there’s the looming threat of Garlean invasion and/or the possibility of world destruction throughout A Realm Reborn and its expansions - but on the plus side, almost everyone you meet is up for a round of cards.


Over the last quarter-century, Triple Triad has managed to escape its origins as a fun side minigame in Final Fantasy VIII to become a fully-fledged phenomenon in XIV. The Gold Saucer runs regular tournaments, random strangers are happy to be challenged to a match - often throwing in one or more of the game’s many variant rules (though Chaos can do one) - and might even give up one of their prized cards when defeated, with almost 400 to collect as of the game’s latest patches. Emphasis on the “might”: I dread to think of the hours spent replaying NPCs in the hope of a random drop as I filled out my collection.

I headed along to Final Fantasy’s London Fan Fest last month with a fetching deck of Triple Triad cards in hand. (Square Enix provided entrance and accommodation for the event.) Where better to try and live the dream of challenging random strangers to a card game, and learn more about the community that has fallen in love with the MMO in the 10 years since A Realm Reborn released?

 
Read more
articles.title: We challenged Final Fantasy XIV fans to real-life Triple Triad matches to celebrate 10 years of the MMO

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Hello folks. It's time for the next gathering of the RPS Game Club! This month, we've been playing Bethesda's mega space RPG Starfield, and we'll be chatting about all your favourite/worst/merely mediocre moments, quests and stories from it later on today, Friday November 3rd,  starting at 4pm GMT / 9am PT / 12pm ET. We're looking forward to it! So see you later on at 4pm sharp.
 Read more
articles.title: Come and chat all things Starfield with us in today's RPS Game Club liveblog

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
Pull switches, press buttons, unscrew panels, mix chemicals, switch broken parts, and pray that following procedure is enough to save you from impossible horrors. That's the fun of Unsorted Horror, a cracking free collection of short first-person horror games with dramatic, doomful scenarios and big, weird machines. No, absolutely you do not get a gun. If you enjoy figuring out how doodads work while feeling like the world has possibly already ended and everyone just kept on going, do play!
Read more
articles.title: Operate strange machinery in these great free horror games

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you've ever gazed out across a landscape of misty spires and vast machines and thought "ah, if only I could explore and savour all that without getting my head kicked in by walking skeletons every five minutes", The Silent Swan from Basque Country, Spain-based developer Praenaris might be the game for you. Released today, it gives you a massive, gloomy map full of towering, greeny-black Gothic structures that are packed with backstory documents, but contain absolutely no enemies. The only thing separating you from all that winding, lore-drenched architecture is distance. Check out the trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Silent Swan, a first-person mystery game with a huge Bloodborne-esque open world, is out now

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Is it a bird? Is it a plane? Is it a FLASHBANG COMING RIGHT AT YOUR FACE - QUICK, LOOK AWAY oh wait it's just a bird after all. That's not just me hallucinating after one too many cups of Joe - it's a description of recent events in Valve's bomb-fiddling FPS Counter-Strike 2, where players keep mistaking the avian decorations on certain maps for bouncing balls of death. 

 
Read more
articles.title: New Counter-Strike 2 update adds workshop features, removes birds which players kept mistaking for grenades

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
I have a confession to make, readers. I'm mildly obsessed with Starfield's cuboid food brand Chunks. In all honesty, I'm kinda obsessed with Starfield's food in a more general sense, and I have almost as many screenshots of its tube-like meal boxes, stale toast slices, vacuum-packed sachets of rice balls, steak slabs and spiced worms - and, of course, Chunks - as I do its planets and NPCs. I'm weirdly fascinated by what Bethesda think our future meals will look like when we eventually start travelling across the stars, and not just because I like ragging on their somewhat plastic-looking textures and marvelling at how everything from orange juice to beer and wine comes in kid's size cartons with a little straw on the side. 
Chunks are my favourite food of the lot, though. These cubes of faintly glistening organic matter are bite-sized monstrosities that are quite possibly some of the most unholy things I've ever seen. How this became the dominating foodstuff across the known galaxy is a mystery worthy of its own sidequest, because let's be honest, I'm all for eating wonky fruit and vegetables, but would you truly go to shop, sit down at a table and order an apple that's been squeezed into a perfect cube? Or a cube with yellow skin that professes to call itself grilled chicken? I would probably try them once for curiosity's sake (it's the food of the future, of course I want to know what that tastes like!), but it's also exactly the kind of thing I'd swear off immediately because nope, nuh uh, I just can't even contemplate it anymore. And then it dawned on me: this is exactly how I feel about Starfield as a whole.
Read more
articles.title: Chunks is the perfect symbol for Starfield: square, mildly unholy, but still quietly fascinating

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Activision-Blizzard's Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 remake is a bit of a mammoth on all platforms, with the Steam page requiring that you set aside 149 GB of SSD space unless you have Call of Duty HQ and Warzone already installed, which drives the total down to a relatively svelte 78 GB. Activision have now posted an explanation for the heavier footprint of this year's Call of Duty, while pointing out that you can customise your install to lighten the load.
Read more
articles.title: Activision defend Modern Warfare 3's larger install size, promising to shrink it before launch

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
"Star Ocean" is a fantastic name, evoking a sense of adventure, 16-bit blue skies, the majesty of space. "The Second Story R" is a terrible subtitle, evoking WhatsApp messages where I accidentally press 'send' too soon. Combined they produce Star Ocean: The Second Story R, a beautiful-seeming 2.5D remake of a Square Enix PlayStation JRPG. It's out on Steam now and there's a demo.

 
Read more
articles.title: Cult '90s JRPG Star Ocean: The Second Story R arrives on PC today

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: CSIRT.CZ)
articles.description: Dnes se podíváme na kampaň šířící malware s využitím Google Ads, která se sofistikovaně bránila odhalení, na další malware v PyPI, na využití AI na GitHubu, na kritickou zranitelnost Confluence a na řadu dalších zranitelností.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: reklamy Google opět zneužity k šíření malware

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Amazon pracuje na vlastním linuxovém operačním systému, který by měl nahradit Fire OS postavený na Androidu. Po několika odkladech vyšla Fedora 39. Tuxedo přichází s třetí generací linuxového notebooku Pulse 14.
articles.title: Tuxedo má třetí generaci Pulse 14, Amazon pracuje na novém systému

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: V neděli 12. listopadu probíhá v Brně druhý den konference OpenAlt. Podívejte se, jak vypadá akce, na které můžete navštívit přednášky, workshopy, stánky a potkat řadu nadšených chytrých lidí.
articles.title: Galerie z neděle na konferenci OpenAlt 2023

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nová verze FFmpeg 6.1, KDE s Waylandem jako výchozím, vývojová verze Wine 8.20, Vulkan ovladač pro Radeony HD 6000 už renderuje trojúhelníky, AOMedia ohlásila multimediální kontejner IAMF pro audio.
articles.title: KDE Plasma přešla na Wayland, nový zvukový kontejner IAMF

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: V sobotu 11. listopadu probíhá v Brně první den konference OpenAlt. Podívejte se, jak vypadá akce, na které můžete navštívit přednášky, workshopy, stánky a potkat řadu nadšených chytrých lidí.
articles.title: Galerie ze soboty na konferenci OpenAlt 2023

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Linux zažil na desktopu, za těch více než 30 let, několik velkých skoků vpřed. Je ale vůbec pravděpodobné, že nějaký další takový skok přijde? Jak by měl vypadat a jaký problém je potřeba ještě řešit?
articles.title: Příští revoluce linuxového desktopu: dosáhl vrcholu nebo je ještě kam jít?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: V dnešním článku si ve stručnosti představíme několik balíčků a technologií, které umožňují snadnou a taktéž rychlou tvorbu webových služeb založených na REST API a relační databázi s využitím jazyka Python.
articles.title: Rychlá tvorba webových služeb s využitím frameworků FastAPI a SQLAlchemy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Satrapa)
articles.description: V článcích o DNS jsme opakovaně zdůraznili distribuovaný charakter DNS databáze. Různé části globálního doménového stromu jsou spravovány různými subjekty a vydávány různými servery. Kde jsou přesně hranice?
articles.title: Principy fungování DNS: domény, zóny a zónové soubory

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Karel Kulhavý)
articles.description:
Dnes uvedeme ukázky digitálního a analogového zvuku s preemfází, která proti
kvantizačnímu zkreslené nepomůže, a budeme studovat účinnost gzipu a bzipu na
analogový signál.
articles.title: Účinnost gzip a bzip2 na ASCII-artovém analogovém zvuku

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si představíme další hudební přehrávač, zkrotíme regulární výrazy, vyzkoušíme si studentský informační systém a stáhneme si videa z příkazové řádky.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (8. 11. 2023): otevřený informační systém pro studenty

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Včera vyšla knihovna OpenBLAS 0.3.25. OpenBLAS je optimalizovaná knihovna BLAS (Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms) a používali jsme ji například při testování stability a výkonu počítače pomocí HPL. Pokud chcete, můžete jednoduše použít novou knihovnu OpenBLAS 0.3.25 místo 0.3.24. Postup kompilace bude stejný.
articles.title: Knihovna OpenBLAS 0.3.25 opravuje detekci Zen 3 a 4

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Evropská unie minulý týden schválila provizorní dohodu o eID (European digital identity). Podle této dohody bude moci každá osoba v EU bezplatně (v případě neprofesionálního použití) prokazovat svoji identitu a přihlašovat se k online službám v celé EU.
articles.title: Provizorní dohoda o evropském eID

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Docker je dnes technologie, která proces vývoje, testování a provozování softwaru velmi zjednodušuje. Provozujte cokoliv a kdekoliv. Už nečekejte na nastavení svého serveru nebo na aktualizaci nějaké knihovny. Mějte prostředí jako součást vaší aplikace.
articles.title: Naučte se pracovat s Dockerem a kontejnery (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Tradiční brněnská konference OpenAlt probíhá o tomto víkendu víkendu 11. a 12. listopadu. Letos došlo po mnoha letech ke změně místa konání akce, je potřeba dorazit na Fakultu informatiky Masarykovy univerzity. Podívejte se na kompletní program, ať něco zbytečně nepropásnete.
articles.title: Začala konference OpenAlt, sledujte živý přenos

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Dnes jsme tu již měli zvýšení výkonu OpenZFS při zápisu. Ve středu pak byla zařazena další novinka a to rozšíření RAID-Z za běhu. RAID-Z je RAID s kontrolními součty rozloženými vedle dat přes všechny disky. Například RADI-Z1 (ochrana před havárií jednoho disku) odpovídá zhruba RAID-5 a RAID-Z2 (ochrana před havárií dvou disků ) odpovídá zhruba RAID-6.
articles.title: RAID-Z v OpenZFS umožňuje rozšíření za běhu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Abyste mohli v současnosti používat šifrovaný komunikační nástroj Signal, musíte se zaregistrovat telefonním číslem a to také musíte sdělit straně, se kterou chcete komunikovat. To může v některých případech vadit. Třeba někdo nechce svoje telefonní číslo vyzradit, protože je to soukromý údaj.
articles.title: Signal testuje uživatelská jména

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V pondělí byla do OpenZFS zařazena úprava, která dovolí paralelně synchronizovat více objektů. Zároveň byla snížena kolize zámků při zápise.
articles.title: OpenZFS umí paralelně synchronizovat více objektů, zvýšila se rychlost zápisu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Tradiční brněnská konference OpenAlt proběhne o tomto víkendu víkendu 11. a 12. listopadu. Letos došlo po mnoha letech ke změně místa konání akce, je potřeba dorazit na Fakultu informatiky Masarykovy univerzity. Podívejte se na kompletní program, ať něco zbytečně nepropásnete.
articles.title: O víkendu proběhne v Brně konference OpenAlt, pozor na změnu místa konání

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Valve oznámilo novou herní konzoli založenou na Linuxu Steam Deck OLED. Hlavní novinkou je 1280 × 800 HDR OLED displej o diagonále 7,4 palce. Původní  1280 × 800 LED měl diagonálu 7 palců. Nové je 6nm AMD APU oproti 7nm ve stávající verzi. Nové APU má stále 4 jádra Zen 2 a RDNA2 GPU. Nová je větší baterie 50 Wh oproti 40 Wh a také podpora WiFi 6E oproti WiFi 5.
articles.title: Valve oznámilo Steam Deck OLED s větší baterií

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Linux je v síťovém prostředí jako doma, může zastat prakticky všechny potřebné role od směrovače (router), přes DHCP, DNS až po souborový server Samba pro Microsoft Windows. Přijďte se to všechno naučit na naše třídenní školení s názvem Linux: správa počítačové sítě.
articles.title: Linux a správa počítačové sítě (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojáři linuxového jádra se rozhodli odstranit podporu architektury Itanium. Dochází k tomu v rámci aktuálního vývoje jádra verze 6.7. Hlavním důvodem je, že architektura sama už je dlouho na ústupu, její rozvoj v jádře se prakticky zastavil. V posledních letech tedy vývojáři jádra považují kód pro Itanium za brzdu dalšího vývoje.
articles.title: Itanium má šanci se vrátit do jádra, ale vývojáři s ním budou mít hodně práce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: O tom, že Ubuntu připravuje neměnný desktop postavený na Ubuntu Core a snapech, jsme psali už v červnu. Nyní Canonical zveřejnil další informace o tomto projektu. Na konferenci v lotyšské Rize měli přednášku o Ubuntu Core a novinkách v projektu pánové Oliver Smith a Ken VanDine.
articles.title: Canonical zveřejnil další podrobnosti o neměnném Ubuntu Core Desktop

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Novým titulem v Edici CZ.NIC je kniha věnovaná principům fungování DNS a nese příznačný název „Domain Name System“. Jejími autory jsou Pavel Satrapa, vysokoškolský pedagog specializující se na počítačové sítě, a Ondřej Filip, výkonný ředitel správce české národní domény a předseda představenstva mezinárodní organizace RIPE NCC.
articles.title: Pavel Satrapa a Ondřej Filip vydávají knihu o principech fungování DNS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojáři z UBports uvolnili Ubuntu Touch 20.04 OTA-3. Jde již v pořadí o třetí vydání založené na tři roky starém Ubuntu Focal Fossa. Ubuntu Touch 20.04 OTA-3 bude v průběhu příštího týdne k dispozici pro následující podporovaná zařízení Ubuntu Touch: Asus Zenfone Max Pro M1, Pro1-X Fairphone 3 a 3+, Fairphone 4, Google Pixel 3a a 3a XL, JingPad A1 Oneplus 5 a 5T, OnePlus 6 a 6T PinePhone (beta), PinePhone Pro (beta) PineTab (beta), PineTab2 (beta), Sony Xperia X, Vollaphone Vollaphone X, Vollaphone 22, Vollaphone X23, Xiaomi Poco M2 Pro, Xiaomi Poco X3 NFC / X3, Xiaomi Redmi Note 9, 9 Pro, 9 Pro Max a 9S.
articles.title: Ubuntu Touch OTA-3 přináší podporu OTA pro PinePhone a PineTab

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: BlueROV2 je podvodní dálkově ovládaná ponorka (Remotely Operated Vehicle, ROV), která dokáže prozkoumávat hlubiny s pomocí jednodeskového počítače Raspberry Pi 4, který je doplněný o přídavnou desku (HAT) jménem Navigator.
articles.title: Dálkově ovládaná ponorka poháněná Raspberry Pi

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Další milník na cestě ke Qt6 verzi desktopu KDE je za námi, vyšla alfa verze prostředí Plasma 6.0. Tvůrci také současně vydali aktualizované verze stavebních prvků KDE Frameworks 6 a také aplikací sdružených v balíku KDE Gear (dříve Applications).
articles.title: KDE Plasma 6.0 Alpha a aktuální verze KDE Gear a KDE Frameworks 6

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Štrobl)
articles.description: Kuberentes je velmi populární nástroj pro správu kontejnerů a jejich škálování. Právě automatické škálování je kritickou funkcí, která je nicméně dobrým sluhou, ale také zlým pánem. Právě o tom bude další meetup Cloud Native Prague, kde se bude probírat, jak správně škálovat a jaké nástroje k tomu použít.
articles.title: Cloud Native Prague #7: škálování v Kubernetes

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: V Rustu psaný webový engine Servo, který se narodil v Mozille, ale už nějakou dobu žije pod křídly evropské Linux Foundation a pracují na něm mimo jiné vývojáři z Igalia, dostal další grant. Ten je tak trochu legrační v tom, že díky němu konečně do Servo přibude podpora HTML tabulek, tedy   atd.
articles.title: Servo Engine dostal grant, implementuje HTML <table>

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: GIMP 2.10.36 je venku a vývojáři hlásí, že pokud půjde vše jako dosud, jde o předposlední verzi dvojkové řady. Každopádně šestatřicítka nepřináší žádné zásadní novinky, jen udržuje loď v chodu, přidává pouze podporu načítání palet z Adobe Swatch Exchange (ASE) a Adobe Color Book (ACB) plus další drobné změny a bezpečnostní opravy. S touto verzí GIMPu se pak nepojí žádné nové verze souvisejících knihoven babl / GEGL / ctx, jakkoli jejich vývoj samozřejmě i nadále běží.
articles.title: Vydán GIMP 2.10.36, nejspíš předposlední verze před GIMPem 3.0

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: VPN umožňuje bezpečně propojit různá zařízení pomocí šifrovaných tunelů. Umožňuje také zapojit uživatele do vnitřní sítě přes zabezpečený přístupový bod. Na školení si prakticky ukážeme, jak to celé nastavit a zprovoznit pomocí nejnovějšího protokolu WireGuard.
articles.title: WireGuard: nasazujeme VPN rychle a jednoduše (online školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Tomáš Heřmánek)
articles.description: Poznejte, jaké pokročilé možnosti a vylepšení vám může přinést monitoring pomocí Zabbix agent 2. Ve čtvrtek 9. listopadu od 10:00 do 12:00 na bezplatném webináři vám zkušený lektor Alois Zadražil detailně představí, jaké pokročilé funkce Zabbix agent 2 přináší, na příkladech z praxe vám ukáže, kdy a jak je vhodné ho využít, a jaké přínosy může jeho nasazení pro monitoring pomoci právě vám. Webinář je bezplatný a stačí se na něj pouze registrovat na www.initmax.cz/webinare/.
articles.title: Poznejte Zabbix Agent 2 na webináři

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Jak GNOME Terminal, tak knihovnu VTE, tedy knihovnu emulátoru terminálu čekají změny k lepšímu. Terminál jako takový je postupně portován z GTK3 na GTK4, v GitLabu GNOME už sedí počáteční implementace.
articles.title: GNOME Terminal míří ke GTK4, knihovna VTE posune 40fps limit

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Na světě je nová verze desktopu LXQt, která jako poslední staví na frameworku Qt 5.15 LTS. Půjde-li vše podle plánů, příští vydání už bude založeno na Qt6.
articles.title: LXQt 1.4.0, poslední verze před přechodem na Qt6

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Po více než dvou letech prací přichází do projektu FFmpeg sada záplat, které plnohodnotně zprovozňují vícevláknový běh tohoto nástroje. Vývojáři konstatují, že bychom měli pozorovat výrazně lepší využití CPU v situacích, kdy proces kódování nebrzdí běh dominantní jednovláknové úlohy a jednotlivé komponenty použité při kódování již mají vícevláknový běh v sobě.
articles.title: FFmpeg značně zefektivní vícevláknový běh

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Téměř přesně na dvacetileté výročí vydání první Fedory byla po několika posunech vydána Fedora 39. Fedora Workstation 39 využívá prostředí GNOME 45, kancelářský balík LibreOffice 7.6, kompilátor LLVM 17 a mnoho dalších aktualizovaných balíčků.
articles.title: Fedora 39 přináší spoustu aktualizací a novou variantu Onyx

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Efektivnější digitalizaci českých firem brání chybějící propojení dat a vhodné datové sklady. Podniky jsou ochotné investovat do digitální transformace. Salesforce Innovation Days Prague ve znamení AI. Nástup AI: Sedm problémů firem, které může vyřešit umělá inteligence. Schneider Electric vydává plán optimalizace datových center s využitím umělé inteligence.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Podniky jsou ochotné investovat do digitální transformace

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 45/2023

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Kolize černých děr pomáhají ověřit nové teorie gravitace. Novinky ze světa kvantových počítačů. Podíl licencovaných patentů je v Česku stále nízký.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Předvedli, jak mohou fungovat mechanické qubity

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: První konference low-code a no-code. Femtosekundový laser může zefektivnit úpravy grafenu pro tranzistory. V oboru podnikových a IT služeb letos přibylo 10 tisíc zaměstnanců. Lenovo představuje vizi AI pro všechny i koncept ohebného telefonu. O co jde AWS v České republice a na Slovensku? Proč by malé a střední podniky měly investovat do správy sítě v cloudu. Konvergovaná bezpečnost podle TTC Marconi.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Femtosekundový laser může zefektivnit úpravy grafenu pro tranzistory

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: V rozpínajícím se vesmíru mohou být páry černých děr stabilní. Vodu na povrchu grafenu brzdí kvantové tření. Vědci a filozofové se pokusili přijít s obecným evolučním zákonem. Záchyty radioaktivity pomůže detekovat RaDron. Jak postavíme na Měsíci silnice?
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Zvukové vlny mohou přeskočit přes vakuum

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 44/2023

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled říjnových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citát týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za říjen 2023

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Jsme u super výprodeje 11.11. Nákup hardwaru znamená velké výdaje, proto co největší úspora za zbytek výbavy, jakou poskytuje Goodoffer24.com, znamená extra výhodu. Naši čtenáři mohou díky ní těžit z dalších 30% slev na vybrané softwarové licence zadáním slevového kódu, který jim umožní například práci doma.
articles.title: Dvojitý výprodej a slevy od Goodoffer24: Windows 10/11 za € 12, Office za € 23!

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Zákazník nechce čekat, až si na něj operátor udělá čas. Nová data Salesforce ukazují „superuživatele“ umělé inteligence. Proč potřebujeme demokratizaci inovací? Veeam představil nové bezpečnostní funkce a pokročilou detekci malwaru. Osvědčené postupy při protokolování cloudu. Analýza: Technické podmínky k rychlému zavedení AI má v ČR téměř polovina firem.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Osvědčené postupy při protokolování cloudu

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 43/2023

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Vědci zkoumali, jak to vlastně je s padáním mince. Vysokoškoláci z let krize mají dnes lepší platy. První černé díry mohly vznikat bez hvězd. Galaxie v Andromedě zažila ve srovnání s Mléčnou dráhou dramata.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Elektrony v grafenových kvantových tečkách obíhají extrémně rychle

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Do 22. listopadu se lze zapojit do soutěže a navrhnout nové loga openSUSE a čtyř distribucí Tumbleweed, Leap, Slowroll a Kalpa. Výhrou je "Geeko Mystery Box".
articles.title: Soutěž: nové loga openSUSE a čtyř distribucí Tumbleweed, Leap, Slowroll a Kalpa

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Představen byl notebook TUXEDO Pulse 14 - Gen3 s 8jádrovým CPU AMD Ryzen 7 7840HS, integrovanou GPU Radeon 780M, 16:10 3K displejem (2880 x 1800) a 32 GB LPDDR5-6400 RAM. Hmotnost notebooku je 1,4 kg. Koupit jej lze s nainstalovaným TUXEDO OS nebo Ubuntu 22.04 LTS. Cena začíná na 1 111 eurech (27 344 korun).
articles.title: Notebook TUXEDO Pulse 14 - Gen3

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: SportsTracker je open source aplikace pro sledování sportovních aktivit. Aplikace není vázána na konkrétní druh sportu, uživatel si může vytvořit kategorie pro všechny druhy sportů jako je cyklistika, běh, plavání nebo tenis. Uživatel získá přehled o aktivitách a může snadno vytvářet diagramy a statistiky pro konkrétní období a typy sportů. V kalendáři může sledovat svou tělesnou hmotnost nebo si vytvářet poznámky, např. tréninkový plán nebo nadcházející sportovní akce. Včera byla vydána verze 8.0.0. Hlavní novinkou je ukládání aplikačních dat do SQLite místo do několika XML souborů.
articles.title: SportsTracker 8.0.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána verze 30.0 svobodného softwaru OBS Studio (Open Broadcaster Software, Wikipedie) určeného pro streamování a nahrávání obrazovky počítače. Přehled novinek na GitHubu. Instalovat lze také z Flathubu.
articles.title: OBS Studio 30.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Konference OpenAlt 2023 proběhne již tento víkend 11. a 12. listopadu. V Brně na FI MUNI. Vstup je zdarma. Na programu je přibližně 70 přednášek nebo workshopů. Kromě toho budou k vidění stánky různých projektů. Konference bude vysílaná živě a po skončení budou k dispozici záznamy jednotlivých přednášek. Přijedete-li do Brna vlakem, z důvodu výluky tramvají se na zastávku Hrnčířská dostanete autobusy x1 a x6.
articles.title: Konference OpenAlt 2023 již tento víkend

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Nadace GNOME oznámila, že Sovereign Tech Fund podpořil projekt GNOME částkou 1 milion eur.
articles.title: Projekt GNOME byl podpořen částkou 1 milion eur

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description:
Společnost Valve představila zařízení Steam Deck OLED. Jedná se o limitovanou edici Steam Decku 
s displejem s vysokým dynamickým rozsahem (HDR), větší výdrží baterie a rychlejší Wi-Fi. Edice je dostupná v omezeném množství pouze ve Spojených státech a Kanadě.
articles.title: Steam Deck OLED

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Renderovací jádro prohlížeče Servo (Wikipedie) získalo grant od NLnet Foundation, mimo jiné na počáteční podporu značky <table>, aby mohly být vyrendrovány tabulky na Wikipedii. Servo je naprogramováno v programovacím jazyce Rust, vzniklo v Mozille a bylo předáno nadaci Linux Foundation.
articles.title: Renderovací jádro prohlížeče Servo získalo grant od NLnet Foundation, mimo jiné na podporu značky <table>

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Novým titulem v Edici CZ.NIC je kniha Domain Name System: Principy fungování DNS a praktické otázky spojené s jeho používáním. Jejími autory jsou Pavel Satrapa, vysokoškolský pedagog specializující se na počítačové sítě, a Ondřej Filip, výkonný ředitel správce české národní domény a předseda představenstva mezinárodní organizace RIPE NCC.
articles.title: Nová kniha z Edice CZ.NIC - Domain Name System: Principy fungování DNS a praktické otázky spojené s jeho používáním

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Josef Průša vysvětluje vztah mezi Prusa Research a Prusa Pro a představuje novou průmyslovou FDM tiskárnu Prusa Pro HT90, dále koncept nadcházející SLA tiskárny Prusa Pro SLX a v neposlední řadě i nejnovější iteraci automatické tiskové farmy (AFS).
articles.title: Prusa Pro: HT90, SLX a AFS

articles.description: AMD today is announcing what they call "the most powerful PRO GPU under $1,000" with the Radeon PRO W7700 that has a suggested price of $999. Like the rest of the Radeon PRO W7000 series, the W7700 enjoys fully upstream and working open-source Linux graphics driver support for launch day. I received an AMD Radeon PRO W7700 and have been putting it through its paces successfully under Linux.
articles.title: AMD Radeon PRO W7700 Launches As $999 GPU With Fully Open-Source Upstream Linux Drivers

articles.description: With the SC23 Super Computing conference kicking off today in Denver, Intel has just lifted the embargo on a number of disclosures.
articles.title: Intel Talks Up Granite Rapids, Falcon Shores & Their Open Software Stack @ SC23

articles.description: Valve's Steam Deck is a heavy user of relying on pre-compiled shaders to yield quicker start times and a more efficient handheld gaming experience. But in cases where bugs happen and a shader compiler fix needs to be back-ported, there isn't a straight-forward means of properly handling that for the Steam Deck. But with new knobs being added to the Mesa RADV driver code, there will be some options for better dealing with this moving forward...
articles.title: RADV Adds Knobs To Force Shader Re-Compilation - Helping Games On The Steam Deck

articles.description: Following the recent talk of XWayland's rootful mode becoming more useful, Red Hat's Olivier Fourdan has continued enhancing the XWayland rootful support. Last week he opened up the merge request for adding HiDPI support to this mode...
articles.title: XWayland Rootful HiDPI Support Under Review

articles.description: Ahead of Supercomputing SC23 week, a new version of OpenBLAS has been published for this leading open-source Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms (BLAS) library. OpenBLAS 0.3.25 brings new improvements for Intel and AMD x86_64 CPUs as well as a number of general improvements, and continued tuning for other architectures like ARM64, POWER, and LoongArch...
articles.title: OpenBLAS 0.3.25 Adds New AVX-512 Optimizations For Sapphire Rapids & More

articles.description: After some time spent in testing, TuxClocker 1.3 with its new AMD GPU features was released as stable overnight...
articles.title: TuxClocker 1.3 Released With New AMD GPU Tuning Capabilities

articles.description: After a very exciting two weeks, the merge window for Linux 6.7 is now wrapped up and Linus Torvalds has published Linux 6.7-rc1 as the first release candidate leading up to the stable release around the end of the calendar year...
articles.title: Linux 6.7-rc1 Released With NVIDIA GSP & Bcachefs While Itanium IA-64 Retired

articles.description: The Linux 6.7 merge window has been downright exciting with additions like Nouveau GSP support and the Bcachefs file-system being added. It's also been downright massive as one of the largest merge windows in recent history in terms of code changes. Here's some statistics of the Linux 6.7 merge window ahead of today's Linux 6.7-rc1 release...
articles.title: The Linux 6.7 Merge Window Is Massive With Many New Features

articles.description: The USB/Thunderbolt subsystem updates were merged a few days ago for Linux 6.7. As Greg Kroah-Hartman put it in the pull request, "nothing really major in here, just lots of constant development for new hardware."..
articles.title: Linux 6.7 USB/Thunderbolt Adds DP Alt Mode 2.1 Support, Intel LJCA

articles.description: While Intel hasn't released a new Atom SoC in years on the consumer side, thanks to the work by Red Hat engineers and others in the open-source community, even drivers for aging Intel Atom platforms continue to receive improvements. One of the areas of ongoing work has been the Linux kernel driver for the Atom ISP camera interface for image signal processing in supporting the web camera on some of these old devices. With Linux 6.7 there is yet more work on the Intel Atom ISP driver...
articles.title: Intel Atom ISP Camera Driver Continues Being Cleaned Up In The Linux Kernel

articles.description: OBS Studio 30.0 was released as stable this evening as the latest version of this cross-platform software that is popular for screen-casting and widely-used by game streamers...
articles.title: OBS Studio 30.0 Released With Intel QSV AV1 On Linux, WHIP/WebRTC Output

articles.description: The Intel-developed Turbostat Linux CLI utility for reporting processor frequency and idle statistics is seeing a number of feature updates for Linux 6.7 as well as new hardware support...
articles.title: Linux's Turbostat Adds Arrow Lake & Lunar Lake Support, Table-Based Feature Enumeration

articles.description: One of the great aspects of Intel integrated and discrete graphics is the broad support for Single Root I/O Virtualization (SR-IOV). Intel "Gen12" graphics back to Tigerlake can handle SR-IOV when there aren't any firmware woes or other issues at play. There is SR-IOV support currently with the i915 kernel driver but Intel engineers are working to architect optimal SR-IOV integration into their forthcoming Xe DRM kernel driver...
articles.title: Intel Begins Sorting Out SR-IOV Support For The Xe Kernel Graphics Driver

articles.description: While it was supposed to ship back in H1'2023, FFmpeg 6.1 finally released last night as the newest feature update to this widely-used multimedia library...
articles.title: FFmpeg 6.1 Released With Vulkan Video Decoding, VA-API AV1 Encode

articles.description: It's been an exciting week in the KDE space as along with releasing Plasma 6.0 Alpha, they have also committed to shipping Plasma 6.0 with the Wayland session being enabled by default...
articles.title: KDE Plasma 6.0 Is Enabling Wayland By Default, Initial Support For HDR-Capable Games

articles.description: Bavarian Linux PC vendor TUXEDO Computers has introduced their first Ryzen 7040 series "Zen 4" Linux laptop in the form of the Pulse 14 Gen 3...
articles.title: TUXEDO Computers Launches Zen 4 Linux Laptop With 32GB RAM & 3K Display

articles.description: Wine 8.20 is out today and it takes care of quite a vintage bug report... A feature request from 2010 to be able to register URL protocol handlers under Linux...
articles.title: Wine 8.20 Closes 13 Year Old Bug To Register URL Protocol Handlers On Linux

articles.description: In addition to the many x86/x86_64 and AArch64 improvements this round for Linux 6.7, on the RISC-V architecture side are some exciting kernel advancements too...
articles.title: RISC-V With Linux 6.7 Gains Optimized TLB Flushing, Software Shadow Call Stacks

articles.description: With recently picking up the Lenovo ThinkPad P14s Gen 4 powered by the AMD Ryzen 7 PRO 7840U and given the recent release of Fedora 39, I found it to be a nice time to provide a Lenovo ThinkPad retrospect of how the AMD Ryzen laptop Linux performance has evolved the past few generations. In today's article is a look at how the AMD Ryzen 7 mobile series laptop performance has evolved going back to Zen 2 for various ThinkPad models while all testing was carried out on the brand new Fedora Workstation 39 Linux release.
articles.title: AMD Ryzen Lenovo Laptop Linux Performance For Zen 2 / Zen 3 / Zen 3+ / Zen 4

articles.description: Slint as a reminder is a Rust-written open-source graphical toolkit that on Linux uses Qt currently underneath. Slint has been making good progress on its goals and today marks the availability of Slint 1.3...
articles.title: Rust-Written GUI Toolkit Slint 1.3 Brings Initial Android Port, Native Styles On Windows

articles.description: Since announcing AVX10 earlier this year, Intel compiler engineers have been quite busy preparing the open-source compiler toolchains like GCC and LLVM/Clang for this next iteration of Advanced Vector Extensions. On Thursday night the latest AVX10.1 work was posted for the GNU Compiler Collection ahead of its upcoming feature freeze...
articles.title: Intel Posts Latest AVX10.1-256 & AVX10.1-512 Compiler Patches For GCC

articles.description: Recently there has been a fair amount of work done to clean-up the Intel/AMD x86 CPU microcode loading (also used by x86_64 CPUs) on Linux that has now been merged for Linux 6.7...
articles.title: Linux 6.7 Overhauls x86 CPU Microcode Loading

articles.description: Vulkan 1.3.270 is out this morning as the latest routine spec update for this high performance graphics and compute API. In addition to the usual assortment of minor fixes/clarifications, there is one new extension this time around...
articles.title: Vulkan 1.3.270 Released With New Imagination Extension To Help OpenGL Emulation

articles.description: Alliance for Open Media (AOMedia) is known for their work on the AV1 video codec and AVIF image file format while now they have released their first royalty-free audio specification...
articles.title: AOMedia Announces Royalty-Free IAMF Audio Container Specification

articles.description: FreeBSD developers have been busy preparing for the release of FreeBSD 14 as well as making a variety of enhancements to this leading BSD operating system...
articles.title: FreeBSD Adding More AMD64 SIMD, Continues Improving Linux Compatibility Layer

articles.description: While AMD officially supports a much narrower range of more recent Radeon hardware with their official graphics drivers for Windows (and Linux - as it pertains to their Radeon Software for Linux packaged driver and AMDVLK official Vulkan driver), thanks to the open-source community around AMD's open-source driver code there are always nifty things that come about... As I wrote about earlier this year, an independent developer has been striving to bring Vulkan to the Radeon HD 6000 series. Yes, the 13 year old "Northern Islands" graphics processors...
articles.title: Terakan Driver Continues Working To Bring Vulkan To The Radeon HD 6000 Series

articles.description: The IOMMU changes for Linux 6.7 aren't particularly noteworthy besides adding SMMUv2 support for the Qualcomm SDM670 and SM7150 SoCs. But the IOMMU updates also take the kernel one step away from supporting Shared Virtual Addressing (SVA) on AMD platforms in the near future...
articles.title: AMD Closing In On IOMMU SVA Support For Linux

articles.description: Valve just announced the Steam Deck OLED as an upgraded version of their Steam Deck handheld Linux gaming device...
articles.title: Valve Announces The Steam Deck OLED With Upgraded Display, 6nm APU & Larger Battery

articles.description: In addition to the OpenZFS code this week landing sync parallelism to improve write performance scalability, another shiny new feature was also merged: RAIDZ expansion...
articles.title: OpenZFS Lands Exciting RAIDZ Expansion Feature

articles.description: Cloud Hypervisor 36 has been released as this Rust-written VMM that started out as an Intel open-source project that since was folded into the Linux Foundation umbrella with support from Microsoft, Arm, and other vendors. More recently even the likes of AMD and Ampere Computing have been onboard with this cloud and security focused virtualization hypervisor...
articles.title: Cloud-Hypervisor 36 Brings AMD CPU Topology Support, AIO Backend For Block Devices

articles.description: Andrew Morton last week sent out all of the memory management "MM" changes for the Linux 6.7 kernel for which there is a lot of code churn...
articles.title: Linux 6.7 MM Brings Performance Optimizations, Better Handling For Unaccepted Memory

articles.description: Since the release of TuxClocker 1.0 back in September, this open-source and independently-developed overclocking/performance utility for Linux systems has been quick to tack on new features and rolling out new versions. A release candidate for TuxClocker 1.3 was issued a few days ago with yet more AMD graphics card controls...
articles.title: TuxClocker 1.3 Preparing Additional AMD GPU Voltage & Memory Controls
Redshift
Parameterball
Messier Objects
Doctor's Office

articles.author: Smangaliso Simelane
articles.description:
With a The Legend of Zelda movie announced, fans have already been speculating on who will be filling which roles. Amidst the lively conversation, Patricia Summersett, who voices Zelda in Tears of the Kingdom, has stated that she would love to return to her role in the upcoming movie. 


In an interview with GamesRadar+, Summersett reveals just how attached she has grown to her role since she voiced in Breath of the Wild. Though she's voiced the princess in three games already, including Hyrule Warriors: Age of Calamity, she claims she "could always take more of it." Of course, this doesn't mean that her return has been confirmed in the upcoming movie, as the cast list has yet to be revealed. 


Screenshot by Destructoid.


The Legend of Zelda movie


Earlier this year, there were rumors that a The Legend of Zelda movie is in the works courtesy of Illumination. The rumors were proven false, though they did correctly predict that Nintendo is working on adapting its highly successful franchise. 


The movie is being directed by Maze Runner's Wes Ball, and it will be produced by Pikmin creator Shigeru Miyamoto and Avi Arad who is chairman of Arad Productions Inc. Somewhat surprisingly, the film is receiving financing from Sony Pictures Entertainment, though more than 50% will be financed by Nintendo. 


With no DLC planned for Tears of the Kingdom, the announced movie is something for fans to look forward to if they're searching for their next big dose of Zelda. No release date has been given yet. 

The post Zelda voice actor “would love to” reprise her role in upcoming The Legend of Zelda movie appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Zelda voice actor “would love to” reprise her role in upcoming The Legend of Zelda movie

articles.author: Smangaliso Simelane
articles.description:
There’s plenty to appreciate in Alan Wake 2 including the clever use of music and lyrics. One catchy song in particular has been popular enough to inspire a fan-made music video for it. Some mild spoilers are ahead.


In Initiation 4: We Sing, Alan finds himself in a weird musical featuring Sam Lake, Mr Door, and the Old Gods of Asgard. The chapter mixes live action with animation, and it provides lyrics so that you can sing along while catching up on the plot thus far. An unofficial video has been made by blending different scenes from throughout the game. It’s done so brilliantly that you’d swear it was an official music video from Remedy.


Screenshot by Destructoid.


Music in Alan Wake 2


The song, called 'Herald of Darkness', is performed by the Finnish band Poets of the Fall who appear as the fictional band Old Gods of Asgard in the Alan Wake franchise. They play a pivotal role in Alan Wake 2 by helping Saga perform a summoning ritual near Cauldron Lake. The band's songs also contain lyrics that are relevant to the game. 




Alan Wake isn’t the only game where Remedy has gone crazy with music. In Control, the soundtrack helps to set the atmosphere, and the Ashtray Maze in particular offers an unforgettable blend of music and game to keep your adrenaline pumping.




'Herald of Darkness' is hitting major streaming sites, including Spotify and Apple Music, on November 15. On December 8, you’ll be able to pick up the Old Gods of Asgard Rebirth - Greatest Hits album. It contains songs from the band found in the Alan Wake series and Control.


We may still get to hear more from the band, as Remedy has DLC planned for Alan Wake 2. The first offering, Night Springs, is scheduled to launch in Spring 2024.

The post There’s an amazing fan-made video for Alan Wake 2’s Herald of Darkness song appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: There’s an amazing fan-made video for Alan Wake 2’s Herald of Darkness song

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
Now that the new DLC for Risk of Rain 2 has been officially revealed under the title Seekers of the Storm, Gearbox has begun its pre-release promotional campaign for it. Its first major checkpoint? A short discussion of Seekers of the Storm's main villain, the ominous-sounding False Son.


More specifically, Gearbox's first official Risk of Rain 2: Seekers of the Storm developer diary is about the DLC's all-new final boss and the lore behind its existence. Though lore hasn't historically been a huge draw in Risk of Rain or its highly acclaimed sequel, Risk of Rain 2, it's worth highlighting that the franchise has a significant narrative backlog going in the background of all the killing. And now, the False Son represents the consequences of what the Survivors have been doing on the planet …
articles.title: Risk of Rain 2 devs hint at DLC boss False Son’s tragic origins

articles.author: Christine Choi
articles.description:
Have you ever been unable to decide between playing Genshin Impact and Pokémon? Or maybe you hate killing things in Genshin and want minions to do your dirty work instead? Well, now that Furina is here, I’ve been able to live my dreams of becoming a Pokémon trainer in Genshin Impact.


So, how do you play Pokémon in Genshin? Certain characters, like Fischl, can summon creatures to fight for them. Fischl can summon a crow familiar named Oz, who stays on-field and deals damage. There are others, too, like Kokomi, who summons a jellyfish, and Xiangling, who summons a small bear named Guoba. Combine multiple summons like this, and you end up with a field full of Pokémon ready to do your bidding.


Taking this concept, I tried to fully clear the current Spiral Abyss with Pokémon teams. Here’s h…
articles.title: My favorite Pokémon teams in Genshin Impact

articles.author: Michael Murphy
articles.description:
It's really going down now. The Japanese channel for Atlus, atlustube, released a taste of the 'reloaded' versions of classic Persona 3 songs alongside some new music tracks for Persona 3 Reload.


Released to promote the Limited Edition of Persona 3 Reload, Atlus previews some of its two-disc soundtrack. The video showcases returning classics like Mass Destruction, When the Moon's Reaching Out Stars, and Living with Determination. 




Meanwhile, samples for new songs exclusive to Persona 3 Reload are also heard, including It's Going Down Now and Color Your Night. Both sound phenomenal and fit right into the themes of the game. 


Changing Seasons


As many have noticed, the original singer for Persona 3, Yumi Kawamura, is absent. Instead, promising newcomer Azumi Takahashi is taking over…
articles.title: Groove along to some of Persona 3 Reload’s new music

articles.author: Michael Murphy
articles.description:
Zagreus has found his new home: Netflix. Revealed during Netflix Geeked Week, Supergiant Games' Hades is coming to Netflix's gaming service in 2024.




The 2020 roguelike is joining the ranks of Immortality, Spiritfarer, and Oxenfree as one of the available games in the service. Netflix Gaming is free for all Netflix subscribers, so owners of the streaming giant can play at no extra cost. The announcement also came with the news that Braid, Death's Door, and Katana Zero would be added in 2024.


It's in the Blood


Hades follows the son of the titular ruler of the underworld, Zagreus, as he tries to escape the Underworld. With the help of the gods of Olympus, you die, die, and die again as you battle through ever-changing maps. Upon its release on Switch and PC, the game was lauded for its character design and addicting roguelike gameplay.


Our own Jordan Devore rated the game a 9/10, citing Supergiant Games' strong storytelling and stellar RPG combat. Hades was nominated for multiple Game of the Year awards and even won Destructoid's own Overall Best Game of 2020. 


I played the heck out of Hades when it was on Game Pass. Seeing it made available for all Netflix subscribers is a joy. Now, more people can play this stellar game whenever and wherever they want. It's a trip to Hell I am down to go to.


The timing for Hades to come to Netflix is pretty coincidental, as Supergiant Games is expanding the universe next year with Hades II. The game, which made its way onto my RPGs to look out for, follows Zagreus' sister, Melinoë. Instead of her father, she'll face the Titan of Time alongside new faces. The game is set to go Early Access in Q2 of 2024 for PC. While it's set to release on consoles, no specifics were given.

The post Beloved roguelike Hades is joining Netflix’s gaming service appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Beloved roguelike Hades is joining Netflix’s gaming service

articles.author: Michael Murphy
articles.description:
The adventures of Lara Croft are looking quite promising. As part of Netflix Geeked Week, Legendary Entertainment released a behind-the-scenes look at the Tomb Raider: The Legend of Lara Croft series.


Powerhouse Animation Studios, known for its Castlevania series, is taking on the daring archaeologist with the help of Legendary Entertainment. Based on Crystal Dynamics' reboots/prequels, Netflix's Tomb Raider: The Legend of Lara Croft sets up the Lara seen in the 1996 original. The video, narrated by Character Design Supervisor Joy Lua, showcases the globe-trotting journeys we'll see her take, as well as some callbacks to different games.




Tomb Raider steps out of the shadows for Netflix


The video starts with some drawings and rough storyboard scenes, previewing some of the show's worldwide action. We see Lara snowboarding off a parachute and traversing buildings in Paris like an action hero. As Lara in the reboot trilogy usually stayed in one country, it's cool to see her out and about. 


Concepts for the places she'll go (yes, including tombs) are shown toward the end. She'll also sport some new gear, donning a dress in one shot and snow gear in another. Of course, she'll have her bow, pickaxe, and pistols alongside her. The team aims to provide many Easter eggs for longtime fans and bridge the gap between old and new. 


While the animated Netflix series picks up after Shadow of the Tomb Raider, reboot era Lara voice actress Camilla Luddington of Grey's Anatomy is not reprising her role, with Marvel the MCU's Agent Carter, Haley Atwell, picking up the dual pistols. Jonah, played by Earl Baylon, is back and given a small look via concept art. As a fan of Castlevania and Powerhouse, as well as the reboots, it seems like Lara is in good hands.


Tomb Raider: The Legend of Lara Croft is slated to release sometime in 2024. 

The post New Tomb Raider show gets behind-the-scenes look appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: New Tomb Raider show gets behind-the-scenes look

articles.author: Andrea Gonzalez
articles.description:
As a kid, I sometimes played odd games I found on the internet or watched playthroughs of them. Most of these were RPG Maker horror games because something about mixing cute art styles with terrifying imagery and plots resonated with a young me. 


The Coffin of Andy and Leyley is probably the first title to take me back to this oddly specific point in my life. Since playing the first two episodes, I can't get it out of my head. 


The game follows siblings Andrew and Ashley Graves as they hatch a plan to escape the apartment they're trapped in. Along the way, they develop a taste for human flesh, and it's quickly clear that both are monsters.


It's a well-written exploration of a toxic sibling dynamic and a revolting experience. I hesitate to call it trashy because it almost always balan…
articles.title: The Coffin of Andy and Leyley is horrifying and I can’t get enough of it

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
Risk of Rain Returns has no shortage of awesome characters that players will want to chase after and unlock as soon as possible, with 15 of them available in total. Now Reddit user m0lmy has posted their experience with unlocking the strange Robomando, a secret 16th playable character. 


"To my knowledge," says m0lmy in their Reddit comment, "I am the first person to unlock this character intentionally." They, of course, posted a whole set of impressively complicated instructions for others to follow in their footsteps.
